snippet: The new terminal’s two berths will be able to accommodate the largest cruise ships in the world — behemoths more than 300 meters long that can carry thousands of passengers.
abstract: Hong Kong's old Kai Tak Airport will reopen as Kai Tak Cruise Terminal, accommodating world's largest cruise ships; decision to spend $1 billion to convert old airport site into cruise terminal is bet on Asia's growing appetite for travel.

byline.contributor: Calvin Yang contributed reporting from Hong Kong.

lead_paragraph: The new terminal’s two berths will be able to accommodate the largest cruise ships in the world — behemoths more than 300 meters long that can carry thousands of passengers.

headline.seo: Kai Tak, Hong Kong’s Old Airport, Reopens as a Cruise Ship Terminal
headline.main: Hong Kong’s Old Airport Reopens as Cruise Ship Terminal
